chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child Under Age of 12
1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child Under Age of 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Greg P Gogin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

*Sex Offender Registry - Life Time Compliance
Sex Offender treatment. 
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.

NO Contact with any family members under any circumstances and in any form. Only Exception is with A.G. Court will allow contact for therapeutic purposes for her and only with her permission and under her conditions. 
Maintain employment and/or school combination.
 No use or possession of any controlled substances, illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

AMENDED 09-19-2017:  Court will allow defendant to have contact with his son.  This contact is subject to approval by DOC.
AMENDED 06/19/2019 COURT WILL ALLOW DEFENDANT TO ALSO HAVE CONTATCT WITH SON G.G. This contact is subject to approval by DOC.

Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Greg P Gogin in court, in custody (OTP'd from DCI), with attorney Sarah M Schmeiser.   

State moves to amend counts 2 and 3.
Amended information filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 3.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant's ex-wife presented statements to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  23 Years.
Initial Confinement:  13 Years.
Extended Supervision:  10 Years.
Consecutive to:  Green County Case 15CF87.
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Sex Offender Treatment.
Sex Offender Registry Life Time Compliance.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any family members under any circumstance and in any form.  Only exception is with A.G. court will allow for contact for theraputic purposes for her and only with her permission and under her conditions.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and refund any balance to the posting party.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be returned to DCI - FORTHWITH.
